THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.
Short title and
commencement.

requirement: The Act shall be known as the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
requirement_description: This requirement specifies the title of the Act, which is a fundamental aspect of the legislation.

controls.control: Establish a comprehensive data protection policy that outlines the organization's commitment to protecting personal data, defines roles and responsibilities, and provides guidelines for data handling and processing.

Classify personal data into different categories based on its sensitivity and risk level, and implement appropriate controls to protect each category, such as encryption, access controls, and data retention policies.
Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access personal data, including role-based access controls, authentication, and authorization mechanisms.
Encrypt personal data both in transit and at rest, using industry-standard encryption algorithms and protocols, such as SSL/TLS and AES.
Establish data retention and disposal policies to ensure that personal data is not retained for longer than necessary, and that it is disposed of securely when no longer needed.

Establish a data breach notification process to inform affected individuals and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach, and to provide them with information about the breach, including the type of data affected and the steps being taken to mitigate the breach.
Establish procedures to enable data subjects to exercise their rights under the Act, including the right to access, correct, and erase their personal data, and to object to processing.

Provide regular data protection training to employees and contractors to ensure that they understand their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data, and to educate them on data protection best practices.

Promote data protection awareness throughout the organization, including through posters, newsletters, and other communication channels, to ensure that everyone understands the importance of protecting personal data.

requirement: The Act shall come into force on a date appointed by the Central Government.
requirement_description: This requirement specifies the commencement date of the Act, which is crucial for its implementation.

controls.control: The Central Government shall define the effective date of the Act in a gazette notification, specifying the date on which the Act shall come into force. This date shall be communicated to all stakeholders, including government departments, regulatory bodies, and the public.

controls.control_title: Publish the Effective Date in a Public Notice
controls.control: The Central Government shall publish the effective date of the Act in a public notice, which shall be displayed on the government's official website and in prominent public places. This notice shall include the date, time, and other relevant details.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of the Effective Date
controls.control: The Central Government shall maintain a record of the effective date of the Act, which shall include the date, time, and other relevant details. This record shall be kept in a secure and accessible location, and shall be made available to authorized personnel upon request.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with the Effective Date
controls.control: All government departments, regulatory bodies, and stakeholders shall ensure that they are aware of and comply with the effective date of the Act. This shall include updating policies, procedures, and systems to reflect the new law, and taking necessary steps to ensure a smooth transition.

requirement: The Act shall be known by its short title and shall come into force on the date specified.
requirement_description: This requirement specifies the short title of the Act and its commencement date, which are essential for its identification and implementation.

controls.control: The organization shall define a short title for the Act and ensure it is clearly stated in all official documents and communications. This title shall be used consistently throughout the organization.
The organization shall establish a specific date for the Act to come into force and ensure that all stakeholders are aware of this date. This date shall be clearly communicated and documented.

The organization shall communicate the details of the Act, including its short title and effective date, to all relevant stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners. This communication shall be done in a timely and transparent manner.

The organization shall review and update the Act as necessary to ensure it remains relevant and effective. This review shall be done on a regular basis, such as annually, to ensure the Act remains aligned with changing business needs and regulatory requirements.

requirement: Establish the Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal as per section 14 of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act, 1997.
requirement_description: The Appellate Tribunal must be established as per the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act, 1997, to handle disputes related to telecommunications.

controls.control_title: Establish the Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal (TDSAT)
controls.control: Create a separate entity for the Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal (TDSAT) as per section 14 of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act, 1997. This entity should be responsible for resolving disputes between telecom service providers and consumers.

Clearly define the jurisdiction of TDSAT, including the types of disputes it can resolve, the parties it can hear, and the geographical areas it covers. This will ensure that TDSAT has the necessary authority to resolve disputes effectively.

controls.control_title: Establish a Fair and Transparent Dispute Resolution Process
controls.control: Develop a fair and transparent dispute resolution process for TDSAT, including clear procedures for filing complaints, hearing cases, and delivering verdicts. This will ensure that all parties involved in a dispute are treated fairly and have access to justice.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Capacity Building for TDSAT Members
controls.control: Provide regular training and capacity building programs for TDSAT members to ensure they have the necessary skills and knowledge to resolve complex disputes effectively. This will also help to build the capacity of TDSAT to handle an increasing number of disputes.

controls.control_title: Establish a Public Grievance Redressal Mechanism
controls.control: Establish a public grievance redressal mechanism to handle complaints from consumers regarding telecom services. This will ensure that consumers have a clear channel to report their grievances and receive a timely response.

Develop a public awareness campaign to educate consumers about the existence and functions of TDSAT, as well as the dispute resolution process. This will help to increase awareness and promote the use of TDSAT as a dispute resolution mechanism.

requirement: Define automated as any digital process capable of operating automatically in response to instructions.
requirement_description: The term 'automated' must be defined as any digital process that can operate automatically in response to instructions for the purpose of processing data.

controls.control: Define a clear and concise policy that outlines what constitutes an automated process, including examples of digital processes that are capable of operating automatically in response to instructions.

Establish a process for identifying and documenting all automated processes within the organization, including their purpose, functionality, and any dependencies or interfaces with other systems or processes.

Develop and implement a change management process for automated processes, including procedures for testing, approval, and deployment of changes to ensure that automated processes continue to operate as intended.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of automated processes, including their design, development, testing, and deployment, to facilitate understanding and maintenance of these processes.
Implement security controls to protect automated processes from unauthorized access, modification, or disruption, including authentication, authorization, and logging mechanisms.

Establish a process for monitoring automated processes to detect and respond to errors, exceptions, or other issues that may impact their operation, including procedures for logging, alerting, and incident management.

requirement_title: Establishment of Data Protection Board of India
requirement: Establish the Data Protection Board of India as per section 18 of the Act.
requirement_description: The Data Protection Board of India must be established by the Central Government as per section 18 of the Act to oversee data protection.

controls.control_title: Establish Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: Establish a Data Protection Board of India as per section 18 of the Act, comprising of a Chairperson and two members, one of whom shall be a woman, to be appointed by the Central Government. The Board shall be responsible for protecting the rights of individuals and ensuring compliance with the Act.

controls.control_title: Define Roles and Responsibilities of Board Members
controls.control: Define the roles and responsibilities of the Chairperson and members of the Data Protection Board of India, including their powers and functions, to ensure effective governance and decision-making.
Develop a governance framework for the Data Protection Board of India, outlining its structure, processes, and procedures, to ensure transparency, accountability, and effective decision-making.

Establish communication channels between the Data Protection Board of India and stakeholders, including individuals, organizations, and government agencies, to facilitate information sharing and collaboration.
Develop a template for recording and maintaining minutes of the Data Protection Board of India meetings, to ensure accurate documentation of decisions and actions taken.

Establish a record retention policy for the Data Protection Board of India, outlining the retention period for records, including meeting minutes, decisions, and other documents, to ensure compliance with the Act.

requirement: Define certain legitimate uses as per section 7 of the Act.
requirement_description: The term 'certain legitimate uses' must be defined as per the uses referred to in section 7 of the Act.

controls.control_title: Establish a Clear Policy on Legitimate Uses
controls.control: Develop and maintain a comprehensive policy that outlines the legitimate uses of data as per section 7 of the Act. The policy should be easily accessible to all employees and stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Define and Document Legitimate Use Criteria
controls.control: Establish clear and concise criteria for determining legitimate uses of data. These criteria should be documented and communicated to all employees and stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Train Employees on Legitimate Use Policy
controls.control: Provide regular training to employees on the legitimate use policy, including the criteria for determining legitimate uses and the consequences of non-compliance.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review Legitimate Use Policy
controls.control: Regularly review and update the legitimate use policy to ensure it remains relevant and effective. Monitor employee adherence to the policy and take corrective action as necessary.

controls.control_title: Establish a Process for Reporting Legitimate Use Requests
controls.control: Develop a process for employees to report legitimate use requests, including a clear procedure for evaluating and approving such requests.

controls.control_title: Document Legitimate Use Requests and Approvals
controls.control: Maintain a record of all legitimate use requests and approvals, including the criteria used to evaluate the requests and the rationale for approval or denial.

requirement: Appoint a Chairperson for the Board.
requirement_description: A Chairperson must be appointed for the Data Protection Board of India to oversee its operations.

controls.control_title: Establish a clear process for appointing the Chairperson
controls.control: Develop and document a clear process for appointing the Chairperson, including the roles and responsibilities of the nominating committee, the selection criteria, and the timeline for the appointment. Ensure that the process is transparent, fair, and free from conflicts of interest.

controls.control_title: Define the selection criteria for the Chairperson
controls.control: Establish clear selection criteria for the Chairperson, including relevant skills, experience, and personal qualities. Ensure that the criteria are aligned with the organization's goals and objectives, and that they are communicated to all stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Ensure the Chairperson is independent and impartial
controls.control: Verify that the Chairperson is independent and impartial, and that they do not have any conflicts of interest that could compromise their ability to make decisions in the best interests of the organization. Ensure that the Chairperson is not beholden to any particular individual or group.

controls.control_title: Provide training and support for the Chairperson
controls.control: Provide the Chairperson with training and support to ensure they have the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their duties effectively. This may include training on governance, leadership, and communication skills, as well as access to resources and expertise.

controls.control_title: Document the appointment of the Chairperson
controls.control: Document the appointment of the Chairperson, including the date of appointment, the selection process, and the reasons for the appointment. Ensure that the documentation is accurate, complete, and easily accessible to all stakeholders.

requirement: Define a child as an individual who has not completed the age of eighteen years.
requirement_description: The term 'child' must be defined as an individual who has not completed the age of eighteen years.

controls.control: Verify the age of each individual at the time of onboarding by collecting and storing their date of birth. This information should be used to determine whether the individual is a child or not.
Develop and implement a logic to validate the age of each individual based on their date of birth. This logic should be used to determine whether the individual is a child or not.

Maintain a document that outlines the age verification process, including the steps taken to verify the age of each individual and the logic used to determine whether the individual is a child or not.
Provide regular training to staff on the age verification process, including the importance of verifying the age of each individual and the consequences of failing to do so.
Regularly monitor and review the age verification process to ensure that it is working effectively and that all individuals are being properly verified.

requirement: Establish a Consent Manager as per the Act.
requirement_description: A Consent Manager must be established to enable Data Principals to give, manage, review, and withdraw their consent through a secure and accessible platform.

controls.control: Implement a Consent Management Platform (CMP) that is compliant with the Act's requirements. The CMP should be able to manage user consent for various purposes, such as data collection, processing, and sharing.

Define clear categories and purposes for which user consent is required. This should include specific descriptions of the data to be collected, processed, and shared, as well as the legal basis for processing.

Obtain explicit user consent before collecting, processing, or sharing personal data. This should be done through a clear and transparent process, with users able to provide or withdraw consent at any time.
Provide users with options and settings to manage their consent, including the ability to opt-in or opt-out of specific purposes or categories of data collection, processing, or sharing.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of user consent, including the date and time of consent, the purpose or category of data collection, processing, or sharing, and any changes to consent status.

Conduct regular audits to ensure that consent management processes are operating effectively and in compliance with the Act's requirements. This should include reviewing consent records, testing consent options and settings, and identifying areas for improvement.

Provide users with clear and transparent information about how their personal data is collected, processed, and shared, including the purposes and categories of data collection, processing, or sharing, and the legal basis for processing.

requirement: Define data as a representation of information suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by human beings or automated means.
requirement_description: The term 'data' must be defined as a representation of information that can be communicated, interpreted, or processed by human beings or automated means.

controls.control: Establish a standard format for data representation, including data types, structures, and encoding schemes, to ensure consistency and interoperability across systems and applications.
Develop and use standardized data schemas, such as XML or JSON, to define the structure and organization of data, and to facilitate data exchange and integration.

Maintain up-to-date documentation of data definitions, including data elements, attributes, and relationships, to ensure that data is accurately interpreted and processed by humans and automated systems.
Provide sample data sets to demonstrate the format and structure of data, and to facilitate testing and validation of data processing and interpretation systems.
Implement data validation mechanisms to ensure that data is accurate, complete, and consistent, and to detect and correct errors or inconsistencies in data representation.
Use encryption mechanisms to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access or tampering, and to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of data in transit or at rest.

requirement: Define Data Fiduciary as any person who determines the purpose and means of processing personal data.
requirement_description: The term 'Data Fiduciary' must be defined as any person who determines the purpose and means of processing personal data.

controls.control_title: Define Data Fiduciary Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Establish a clear definition of Data Fiduciary roles and responsibilities within the organization. This includes identifying individuals who determine the purpose and means of processing personal data. Ensure that these roles and responsibilities are documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

Conduct a thorough review of the organization's processes and systems to identify individuals who determine the purpose and means of processing personal data. This includes data controllers, data processors, and other stakeholders involved in personal data processing.

Establish a process to document all decisions made by Data Fiduciaries regarding the purpose and means of processing personal data. This includes recording the rationale behind these decisions and any relevant considerations.
Provide regular training and awareness programs for Data Fiduciaries on their roles and responsibilities, as well as the organization's data protection policies and procedures.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review Data Fiduciary Activities
controls.control: Establish a process to monitor and review the activities of Data Fiduciaries to ensure compliance with the organization's data protection policies and procedures. This includes regular audits and reviews of personal data processing activities.

requirement: Define Data Principal as the individual to whom personal data relates, including parents or guardians for children.
requirement_description: The term 'Data Principal' must be defined as the individual to whom personal data relates, including parents or guardians for children.

controls.control: Establish a process to identify the Data Principal for each personal data record, including parents or guardians for children. This may involve collecting and storing information such as name, date of birth, and contact details.
Implement a verification process to confirm the identity of the Data Principal, particularly for children, to ensure that personal data is only accessible to authorized individuals.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of Data Principal information, including parents or guardians for children, to facilitate compliance with data subject rights and other regulatory requirements.

controls.control_title: Limit Access to Data Principal Information
controls.control: Restrict access to Data Principal information to only those individuals who require it to perform their job functions, and ensure that access is revoked when no longer necessary.

controls.control_title: Notify Data Principals of Data Collection
controls.control: Provide clear and transparent notice to Data Principals about the collection, use, and disclosure of their personal data, including the purposes for which it will be used.

requirement: Define Data Processor as any person who processes personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary.
requirement_description: The term 'Data Processor' must be defined as any person who processes personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary.

controls.control_title: Define Data Processor Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Establish clear roles and responsibilities for Data Processors, including their obligations under the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures. This should include, but not be limited to, data collection, storage, and processing requirements.

controls.control_title: Conduct Due Diligence on Data Processors
controls.control: Conduct thorough due diligence on all Data Processors before engaging their services, including assessing their data protection policies, procedures, and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Enter into written agreements with all Data Processors that outline their responsibilities, obligations, and liabilities under the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures.

Regularly monitor Data Processor activities to ensure they are complying with the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures, and to identify and address any potential data protection risks or issues.

controls.control_title: Ensure Data Processor Compliance with Laws and Regulations
controls.control: Ensure that all Data Processors are compliant with relevant laws and regulations, including data protection laws, and that they have implemented adequate data protection measures to protect personal data.

Provide Data Processors with training on the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures, as well as relevant laws and regulations, to ensure they understand their obligations and responsibilities.

requirement: Appoint a Data Protection Officer as per section 10 of the Act.
requirement_description: A Data Protection Officer must be appointed by the Significant Data Fiduciary as per section 10 of the Act to oversee data protection.

controls.control: Appoint a Data Protection Officer as per section 10 of the Act. The Data Protection Officer should be a senior employee with sufficient authority to oversee data protection policies and procedures. The officer should be responsible for ensuring compliance with the Act and should be the primary point of contact for data protection inquiries.

controls.control_title: Define the Role and Responsibilities of the Data Protection Officer
controls.control: Clearly define the role and responsibilities of the Data Protection Officer, including their duties, authorities, and reporting lines. This should be documented in a written policy or procedure and communicated to all employees.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Resources for the Data Protection Officer
controls.control: Provide the Data Protection Officer with the necessary training, resources, and support to perform their duties effectively. This should include training on data protection laws and regulations, as well as access to relevant documentation and tools.

controls.control_title: Establish a Data Protection Compliance Framework
controls.control: Establish a data protection compliance framework that outlines the organization's data protection policies, procedures, and standards. This should include guidelines for data collection, storage, processing, and disposal, as well as procedures for handling data breaches and complaints.

controls.control_title: Review and Update the Data Protection Officer's Appointment
controls.control: Review and update the Data Protection Officer's appointment annually to ensure that they continue to meet the requirements of section 10 of the Act. This should include verifying their qualifications, experience, and authority to perform their duties.

requirement: Define digital office as an office that adopts an online mechanism for electronic proceedings.
requirement_description: The term 'digital office' must be defined as an office that adopts an online mechanism for electronic proceedings.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that outlines the adoption of online mechanisms for electronic proceedings, including the scope, responsibilities, and procedures for digital office operations.
Select, implement, and maintain a secure and reliable electronic proceedings platform that supports online meetings, document sharing, and collaboration tools.
Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the use of digital office tools, procedures, and best practices to ensure effective adoption and utilization.

controls.control_title: Establish Data Security and Backup Procedures
controls.control: Develop and implement procedures for securing and backing up digital office data, including regular backups, data encryption, and access controls to prevent unauthorized access.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Evaluate Digital Office Operations
controls.control: Regularly monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of digital office operations, including user adoption, system performance, and compliance with policies and procedures.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Digital Office Policy
controls.control: Periodically review and update the digital office policy to ensure it remains relevant, effective, and compliant with changing regulatory requirements and industry best practices.

requirement: An office must adopt an online mechanism for conducting proceedings.
requirement_description: This requirement specifies that a digital office must use an online mechanism for conducting proceedings from receipt to disposal.

controls.control_description: Select and implement a reliable online meeting platform that supports video conferencing, screen sharing, and recording. Ensure the platform is accessible on various devices and browsers.
Regularly conduct security audits on the online meeting platform to identify vulnerabilities and ensure the platform is secure and compliant with relevant regulations.

controls.control_title: Establish Clear Guidelines for Online Proceedings
controls.control_description: Develop and communicate clear guidelines for conducting online proceedings, including rules for participation, etiquette, and technical requirements.
Provide technical support to participants to ensure they can access and use the online meeting platform effectively.
Document online proceedings, including minutes, decisions, and actions taken, to ensure transparency and accountability.
Regularly evaluate the effectiveness of online proceedings, including participant satisfaction, engagement, and outcomes, to identify areas for improvement.

requirement: Personal data must be in digital form to be considered digital personal data.
requirement_description: This requirement defines digital personal data as personal data in digital form.

controls.control: Implement a data validation process to ensure that all personal data is in a digital format. This can be achieved through automated checks or manual reviews to verify the format of the data.

Ensure that all personal data is stored in a digital format, either in a database, cloud storage, or other electronic storage systems. This will help maintain the integrity and accessibility of the data.
Regularly monitor and review the process of converting paper-based personal data to digital format. This will help identify any potential issues or discrepancies in the conversion process.
Establish and enforce standards for digital personal data formats, such as CSV, JSON, or XML, to ensure consistency and interoperability across different systems and applications.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Digital Data Handling
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for staff on the importance of handling digital personal data correctly, including the need to maintain its digital format.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that defines what constitutes a gain, including property, supply of services, opportunities to earn remuneration, or financial advantages. The policy should be communicated to all employees and relevant stakeholders.

Implement a process for employees to identify and report any potential gains, including property, supply of services, opportunities to earn remuneration, or financial advantages. This process should be documented and communicated to all employees.

Provide regular training to employees on the definition of a gain, the policy, and the reporting process. This training should be documented and include a mechanism for employees to ask questions or seek clarification.

Establish a process to monitor and review reports of potential gains, including property, supply of services, opportunities to earn remuneration, or financial advantages. This process should include a mechanism for investigating and addressing any reported gains.

Establish a whistleblower protection policy that encourages employees to report any potential gains, including property, supply of services, opportunities to earn remuneration, or financial advantages, without fear of retaliation. This policy should be communicated to all employees and relevant stakeholders.

Implement a process to document all gain-related transactions, including property, supply of services, opportunities to earn remuneration, or financial advantages. This documentation should be maintained for a minimum of [insert timeframe] years.

requirement: A loss is defined as a loss in property or supply of services, or a loss of opportunity to earn remuneration or a financial advantage.
requirement_description: This requirement defines loss as a loss in property or supply of services, or a loss of opportunity to earn remuneration or a financial advantage.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy and procedures for defining and reporting losses. This should include a comprehensive definition of loss, examples of loss scenarios, and a process for reporting and investigating losses.

Regularly assess the organization's risk profile to identify potential losses and implement controls to mitigate or manage these risks. This should include a review of financial, operational, and strategic risks.

Implement measures to prevent losses, such as physical security controls, access controls, and monitoring systems. This should also include regular maintenance and testing of these controls to ensure their effectiveness.

Develop and implement an incident response plan to respond to losses and minimize their impact. This should include procedures for reporting, investigating, and containing losses, as well as procedures for communicating with stakeholders.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on loss prevention and response procedures. This should include information on the organization's loss policy, procedures for reporting losses, and the importance of loss prevention.

Regularly monitor and review losses to identify trends and areas for improvement. This should include a review of loss data, analysis of loss causes, and implementation of corrective actions to prevent future losses.

requirement: A Member of the Board includes the Chairperson.
requirement_description: The definition of a Member includes the Chairperson, indicating that the Chairperson is also considered a Member of the Board.

controls.control: Verify that the Chairperson is included as a member of the Board by reviewing the Board's membership list and ensuring that the Chairperson's name is present.
Review the minutes of Board meetings to ensure that the Chairperson is present and participating in discussions, and that their role and responsibilities are clearly documented.
Update the organization's documentation, including the Board's membership list and bylaws, to reflect the inclusion of the Chairperson as a member of the Board.
Verify that the Chairperson has voting rights as a member of the Board and that their votes are counted in Board decisions.
Monitor the Chairperson's attendance at Board meetings and ensure that they are actively participating in Board discussions and decision-making processes.

requirement: A notification is a notification published in the Official Gazette.
requirement_description: The definition of a notification clarifies that it is a notification published in the Official Gazette, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes a notification.

controls.control: Verify that the notification was published in the Official Gazette by checking the publication date and the Gazette's official logo or watermark. This can be done by reviewing the Gazette's website, archives, or physical copies.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of notifications published in the Official Gazette, including publication dates, notification numbers, and relevant metadata. This will facilitate easy verification and auditing.
Regularly monitor the Official Gazette's website for updates, including new publications and corrections. This will ensure that notifications are promptly available to the public and stakeholders.

Verify the authenticity of the Official Gazette publication by checking the publication's digital certificate, timestamp, or other security features. This will prevent tampering or unauthorized modifications.
Ensure that the Official Gazette publication is accessible to the public, including through online platforms, physical copies, or other means. This will facilitate transparency and accountability.

requirement: A person includes an individual, a Hindu undivided family, a company, a firm, an association of persons or a body of individuals, the State, and every artificial juristic person.
requirement_description: The definition of a person includes various entities, such as individuals, companies, and the State, indicating that these entities are considered persons under this Act.

controls.control: Verify the type of entity (individual, Hindu undivided family, company, firm, association of persons, body of individuals, State, or artificial juristic person) before processing any transactions or providing services.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the entity type for each customer or client, including any relevant documentation or certifications.
Implement a validation process to ensure that the entity type is correctly identified and recorded, and that any discrepancies are promptly investigated and resolved.
Screen all entities against relevant sanctions lists to prevent dealings with prohibited or high-risk entities.
Conduct thorough KYC procedures to verify the identity and legitimacy of entities, including individuals and organizations.
Provide regular training to staff on the correct identification and classification of entity types, and the importance of accurate record-keeping.

requirement: Personal data refers to any data about an individual that is identifiable.
requirement_description: The definition of personal data clarifies that it refers to any data about an individual that can be identified, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes personal data.

controls.control: Collect and store only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes limiting the types of data collected and avoiding unnecessary data collection.
Anonymize personal data whenever possible to prevent identification of individuals. This can be achieved through techniques such as pseudonymization, encryption, or data masking.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access personal data. This includes implementing role-based access controls, secure authentication, and authorization mechanisms.

Establish a data retention policy that outlines how long personal data will be stored and when it will be disposed of. This includes implementing secure disposal methods for data that is no longer needed.

Establish procedures for responding to data subject requests, including the right to access, correct, and erase personal data. This includes implementing a process for handling subject access requests (SARs).
Maintain an inventory of personal data stored within the organization. This includes identifying the types of data collected, the sources of the data, and the purposes for which the data is used.

Establish procedures for notifying individuals and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach. This includes implementing a process for identifying and responding to data breaches in a timely manner.

requirement: A personal data breach occurs when there is an unauthorized processing or accidental disclosure of personal data that compromises confidentiality, integrity, or availability.
requirement_description: The definition of a personal data breach highlights the importance of protecting personal data and the consequences of a breach, which can compromise confidentiality, integrity, or availability.

controls.control: Develop and implement an incident response plan that includes procedures for responding to personal data breaches. The plan should include roles and responsibilities, communication protocols, and procedures for containing and eradicating the breach.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Risk Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and potential risks to personal data. This will help to identify areas where personal data may be compromised and take corrective action to mitigate these risks.

Implement access controls and authentication mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This includes implementing role-based access controls, multi-factor authentication, and secure password management practices.

Encrypt personal data both in transit and at rest to protect against unauthorized access and disclosure. This includes implementing encryption protocols such as SSL/TLS for data in transit and encrypting data at rest using techniques such as AES.
Provide regular training to personnel on data protection policies and procedures, including the handling of personal data and the procedures for responding to personal data breaches.

Implement data loss prevention (DLP) tools to monitor and prevent the unauthorized disclosure of personal data. This includes implementing DLP software and configuring it to monitor and block sensitive data from being sent via email or other communication channels.

requirement: Prescribed refers to rules made under this Act.
requirement_description: The definition of prescribed clarifies that it refers to rules made under this Act, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes prescribed rules.

controls.control: Establish a centralized repository to store and document all prescribed rules made under this Act. Ensure that the repository is easily accessible to all stakeholders and is regularly updated to reflect changes to the rules.

Develop a process to identify and track all prescribed rules made under this Act. This should include monitoring changes to the rules, tracking the status of new rules, and ensuring that all stakeholders are aware of the rules that apply to them.

Provide regular training to employees on the prescribed rules made under this Act. This should include an overview of the rules, how they apply to the organization, and the consequences of non-compliance.

Conduct regular compliance audits to ensure that the organization is adhering to the prescribed rules made under this Act. This should include reviewing policies, procedures, and practices to ensure that they are in compliance with the rules.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all prescribed rules made under this Act. This should include records of changes to the rules, implementation dates, and any relevant documentation.

Communicate the prescribed rules made under this Act to all stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners. This should include providing clear and concise information on the rules and their application.

requirement: A proceeding refers to any action taken by the Board under this Act.
requirement_description: The definition of a proceeding clarifies that it refers to any action taken by the Board under this Act, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes a proceeding.

controls.control: Establish a clear and comprehensive list of proceeding types, including but not limited to, investigations, hearings, and appeals. This list should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

Maintain accurate and detailed records of all proceedings, including but not limited to, dates, times, locations, and outcomes. These records should be stored securely and made available for audit and review purposes.

Develop and implement procedures for notifying relevant parties, including but not limited to, individuals involved in the proceeding, their representatives, and the public, of the commencement and outcome of proceedings.
Schedule regular reviews of all proceedings to ensure compliance with the Act and to identify areas for improvement. These reviews should be documented and used to inform future proceeding practices.

controls.control_title: Provide Proceeding Information to the Public
controls.control: Make information about proceedings, including but not limited to, dates, times, locations, and outcomes, available to the public through a designated website or other accessible means.

Provide regular training to staff on proceeding procedures, including but not limited to, documentation, notification, and review requirements. This training should be documented and updated as necessary.

requirement: Processing refers to any automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data.
requirement_description: The definition of processing clarifies that it refers to any automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes processing.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough impact assessment to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing digital personal data. This includes identifying the types of data being processed, the purposes of processing, and the potential consequences of a data breach.

Only process the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes implementing data retention policies and procedures to ensure that data is not stored for longer than necessary.

Implement robust encryption measures to protect digital personal data in transit and at rest. This includes using industry-standard encryption protocols and ensuring that encryption keys are securely stored and managed.

Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to digital personal data. This includes implementing authentication and authorization procedures to prevent unauthorized access.

Maintain accurate and detailed logs of all data processing activities, including date, time, and type of processing. This includes implementing logging and monitoring procedures to detect and respond to potential security incidents.

Establish procedures to respond to data subject requests for access, correction, and deletion of their personal data. This includes implementing a process for handling subject access requests and ensuring that data subjects are informed of their rights.

requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary is any Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries notified by the Central Government under section 10.
requirement_description: The definition of a Significant Data Fiduciary clarifies that it refers to any Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries notified by the Central Government under section 10, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes a Significant Data Fiduciary.

controls.control: Establish a process to receive and acknowledge notifications from the Central Government regarding Significant Data Fiduciaries. This process should include clear roles and responsibilities, timelines for response, and documentation of all notifications received.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Register of Significant Data Fiduciaries
controls.control: Maintain a register of all Significant Data Fiduciaries notified by the Central Government. This register should be updated regularly and include details such as the name and address of the Data Fiduciary, the date of notification, and any subsequent changes.

Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance with the notification requirements. This should include checks on the accuracy of the register, verification of notifications received, and assessment of any changes to the Data Fiduciary's status.

Provide training to staff on the notification requirements and the process for receiving and acknowledging notifications. This should include information on the roles and responsibilities of staff, the importance of accurate documentation, and the consequences of non-compliance.

Maintain accurate and complete records of all notifications received from the Central Government, including correspondence and any subsequent communications. These records should be securely stored and easily accessible for audit and review purposes.

requirement: A specified purpose refers to the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal.
requirement_description: The definition of a specified purpose clarifies that it refers to the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal, which provides a clear understanding of what constitutes a specified purpose.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must clearly define the purpose of data collection in the notice provided to the Data Principal. This purpose must be specific, concise, and easily understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary must maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the purpose of data collection as stated in the notice. These records must be easily accessible and retrievable for auditing purposes.

The Data Fiduciary must provide regular training to its staff on the importance of clearly disclosing the purpose of data collection in the notice provided to the Data Principal. This training must cover the specific requirements of the purpose disclosure and the consequences of non-compliance.

The Data Fiduciary must regularly review and update the purpose notice to ensure it remains accurate and relevant. This review must be conducted at least annually or whenever there is a change in the purpose of data collection.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent for Purpose Change
controls.control: If the Data Fiduciary intends to change the purpose of data collection, it must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before implementing the change. This consent must be obtained through a separate notice that clearly explains the new purpose and the implications of the change.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must clearly define the specified purpose in the notice given to the Data Principal. This purpose must be concise, specific, and easily understandable by the Data Principal. The purpose should be stated in a way that it is not ambiguous or open-ended.

The Data Fiduciary must document the purpose in the notice given to the Data Principal. This documentation must be maintained for a minimum of 5 years and made available upon request to the Data Principal or regulatory bodies.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Purpose in Notice

The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal for the purpose stated in the notice. This consent must be obtained prior to collecting or processing any personal data and must be documented.

The Data Fiduciary must review and update the purpose in the notice given to the Data Principal regularly. This review must be conducted at least annually and any changes to the purpose must be documented and communicated to the Data Principal.

requirement: The term 'State' must be defined as per the Constitution.
requirement_description: The term 'State' must be defined in accordance with the definition provided in article 12 of the Constitution.

controls.control_title: Define 'State' in accordance with the Constitution
controls.control: Establish a clear definition of 'State' in accordance with the Constitution, and ensure that all relevant stakeholders are aware of this definition. This definition should be documented and easily accessible to all personnel.

Regularly review and verify that the definition of 'State' is accurate and consistent with the Constitution. This should be done at least annually, or whenever there are changes to the Constitution or relevant laws.

Maintain a record of any changes to the definition of 'State', including the date of the change, the reason for the change, and the updated definition. This will help to ensure that all stakeholders are aware of any changes and can adapt accordingly.

controls.control_title: Ensure 'State' definition is used consistently across the organization
controls.control: Establish a process to ensure that the definition of 'State' is used consistently across the organization, including in all policies, procedures, and communications. This will help to prevent confusion and ensure that all stakeholders are on the same page.

Provide training to all personnel on the definition of 'State' and its application in the organization. This will help to ensure that all personnel understand the definition and can apply it correctly.

article_text:
3. Subject to the provisions of this Act, it shall—
(a) apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India
where the personal data is collected––
(i) in digital form; or
(ii) in non-digital form and digitised subsequently;
(b) also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of
India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of
goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India;
Application
of Act.
requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India.
requirement_description: The Act is applicable to the processing of digital personal data collected within India, in digital or non-digital form.

controls.control: Ensure that all digital personal data is processed within the territory of India. This includes storing data in Indian data centers, using Indian cloud services, and ensuring that all data processing activities are carried out within India.
Implement controls to restrict the transfer of digital personal data outside the territory of India, unless explicit consent is obtained from the data subject or as permitted under the Act.

Establish clear policies and procedures for the storage and retention of digital personal data within India. This includes defining data retention periods, data archiving, and data destruction procedures.
Implement processes to enable data subjects to exercise their rights under the Act, including the right to access, correct, and delete their digital personal data.
Ensure that digital personal data is protected by design and default, including implementing data protection features in software and systems used for processing digital personal data.
Implement default data protection settings for all systems and software used for processing digital personal data, including encryption, access controls, and data backup procedures.

requirement_title: Applicability of the Act to Digital Personal Data outside India
article_text:

(a) apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India
where the personal data is collected––
(i) in digital form; or
(ii) in non-digital form and digitised subsequently;
(b) also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of
India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of

Application
of Act.
requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data outside India if it is in connection with offering goods or services to Data Principals within India.
requirement_description: The Act is applicable to the processing of digital personal data outside India if it is related to offering goods or services to individuals within India.

controls.control_title: Conduct a Risk Assessment for Cross-Border Data Processing
controls.control: Conduct a thorough risk assessment to identify the risks associated with processing digital personal data of Data Principals within India when offering goods or services outside India. This assessment should consider the nature of the data, the countries involved, and the potential impact on Data Principals.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Implement data protection by design and default principles when processing digital personal data of Data Principals within India, even if the processing occurs outside India. This includes ensuring that data collection, storage, and processing are done in a way that respects the rights and freedoms of Data Principals.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent for Cross-Border Data Transfer
controls.control: Obtain explicit consent from Data Principals within India before transferring their digital personal data outside India, unless an exemption applies. This consent should be informed, specific, and freely given.

Implement data transfer agreements with third-party processors or controllers outside India that ensure the protection of digital personal data of Data Principals within India. These agreements should include provisions for data protection, security, and compliance with Indian data protection laws.

controls.control_title: Maintain Records of Cross-Border Data Processing
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of cross-border data processing activities, including the types of data processed, the countries involved, and the measures taken to protect the data. These records should be kept for a minimum of 5 years.

requirement: Personal data processed by an individual for personal or domestic purposes is exempt.
requirement_description: This requirement states that personal data processed by an individual for personal or domestic purposes is not subject to the provisions of this Act.

controls.control: Classify personal data processed by individuals for personal or domestic purposes as 'exempt' to ensure it is not subject to data protection regulations. This classification should be clearly documented and communicated to all relevant personnel.

Ensure that individuals processing personal data for personal or domestic purposes provide a clear notice to data subjects about the data being collected, its purpose, and how it will be used. This notice should be easily accessible and transparent.

Educate data subjects on their rights and responsibilities when processing personal data for personal or domestic purposes. This includes informing them about the exemption from data protection regulations and the importance of handling personal data securely.

Implement robust data storage and security measures to protect personal data processed by individuals for personal or domestic purposes. This includes using secure devices, encrypting data, and limiting access to authorized personnel.

Establish clear policies and procedures for the retention and disposal of personal data processed by individuals for personal or domestic purposes. This includes ensuring that data is not retained longer than necessary and that it is disposed of securely when no longer needed.

X, an individual, while blogging her views, has publicly made available her personal

requirement: Personal data made publicly available by the Data Principal or under law is exempt.
requirement_description: This requirement states that personal data made publicly available by the Data Principal or under a law in force in India is not subject to the provisions of this Act.

controls.control: Verify that the personal data in question has indeed been made publicly available by the Data Principal or under law. This can be done by checking publicly available sources, such as social media or government records, or by obtaining documentation from the Data Principal that confirms the data was made public.

Maintain documentation that records the date and method by which the personal data was made publicly available. This documentation should be kept on file and made available to relevant authorities upon request.

Provide training to staff on the importance of verifying the public availability of personal data before processing it. This training should cover the procedures for verifying public disclosure and the consequences of failing to do so.

Implement a data classification system that categorizes personal data based on its level of sensitivity and the level of protection required. This system should include clear guidelines for handling personal data that has been made publicly available.

Regularly monitor publicly available sources for updates or changes to personal data that may have been made publicly available. This can help ensure that the organization is aware of any changes to the data and can take appropriate action.

requirement_title: Lawful Purpose for Processing Personal Data
article_text:
CHAPTER II
OBLIGATIONS OF DATA FIDUCIARY
4. (1) A person may process the personal data of a Data Principal only in accordance
with the provisions of this Act and for a lawful purpose,—
(a) for which the Data Principal has given her consent; or
(b) for certain legitimate uses.
(2) For the purposes of this section, the expression “lawful purpose” means any
purpose which is not expressly forbidden by law.
5. (1) Every request made to a Data Principal under section 6 for consent shall be
accompanied or preceded by a notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal,
informing her,—
  (i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same is proposed to be
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4) of
section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.
Illustration.
X, an individual, opens a bank account using the mobile app or website of Y , a bank.
To complete the Know-Your-Customer requirements under law for opening of bank account,
X opts for processing of her personal data by Y in a live, video-based customer identification
process. Y shall accompany or precede the request for the personal data with notice to X,
describing the personal data and the purpose of its processing.
(2) Where a Data Principal has given her consent for the processing of her personal
data before the date of commencement of this Act,—
(a) the Data Fiduciary shall, as soon as it is reasonably practicable, give to the
Data Principal a notice informing her,––
(i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same has been
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4)
of section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the
Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.

personal data.

requirement: Personal data can only be processed for a lawful purpose.
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that personal data is processed for a purpose that is not prohibited by law.

controls.control_title: Define Lawful Purpose for Data Processing
controls.control: Establish a clear and documented purpose for processing personal data. This purpose should be specific, legitimate, and aligned with the organization's goals. Ensure that all stakeholders understand the purpose and ensure it is communicated to data subjects.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent for Data Processing
controls.control: Obtain explicit and informed consent from data subjects before processing their personal data for any purpose. Ensure that consent is freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous. Document all consent requests and responses.

Regularly review the purposes for which personal data is being processed to ensure they remain valid and compliant with applicable laws and regulations. Update purposes as necessary and communicate changes to stakeholders and data subjects.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all data processing activities, including the purposes for which data is being processed. Ensure that records are easily accessible and can be provided to data subjects upon request.

controls.control_title: Notify Data Principal Upon Commencement of the Act
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must notify the Data Principal in writing or electronically within 3 business days of the commencement of the Act. The notification must include the date the Act commenced, the purpose of the Act, and the rights and obligations of the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary must maintain a record of all notifications sent to Data Principals, including the date and time of notification, the method of notification, and the content of the notification. This record must be retained for a minimum of 5 years.

The Data Fiduciary must provide regular training to all staff on the notification requirements under the Act, including the procedures for notifying Data Principals and the importance of maintaining accurate records of notifications.

The Data Fiduciary must verify the identity of the Data Principal before sending notification, using a secure and reliable method such as government-issued ID or a secure online authentication process.
The Data Fiduciary must review and update its notification process at least annually to ensure it remains compliant with the Act and to identify areas for improvement.

requirement_title: Free, Specific, Informed, Unconditional, and Unambiguous Consent
article_text:
6. (1) The consent given by the Data Principal shall be free, specific, informed,
unconditional and unambiguous with a clear affirmative action, and shall signify an
agreement to the processing of her personal data for the specified purpose and be limited to
such personal data as is necessary for such specified purpose.
Illustration.
X, an individual, downloads Y , a telemedicine app. Y requests the consent of X for (i)
the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services, and ( ii)
accessing her mobile phone contact list, and X signifies her consent to both. Since phone
contact list is not necessary for making available telemedicine services, her consent shall be
limited to the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services.
(2) Any part of consent referred in sub-section (1) which constitutes an infringement
of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder or any other law for the time being
in force shall be invalid to the extent of such infringement.
Illustration.
X, an individual, buys an insurance policy using the mobile app or website of Y , an
insurer. She gives to Y her consent for (i) the processing of her personal data by Y for the
purpose of issuing the policy, and ( ii) waiving her right to file a complaint to the Data
Protection Board of India. Part ( ii) of the consent , relating to waiver of her right to file a
complaint, shall be invalid.
(3) Every request for consent under the provisions of this Act or the rules made
thereunder shall be presented to the Data Principal in a clear and plain language, giving her
the option to access such request in English or any language specified in the Eighth
Schedule to the Constitution and providing the contact details of a Data Protection Officer,
where applicable, or of any other person authorised by the Data Fiduciary to respond to
any communication from the Data Principal for the purpose of exercise of  her rights under

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal through a clear and transparent process. This consent must be obtained prior to collecting, processing, or sharing any personal data.

The Data Fiduciary must provide the Data Principal with clear and transparent information about the purpose, scope, and duration of data processing, as well as any potential risks or consequences associated with data sharing.

controls.control_title: Ensure Consent is Specific and Unambiguous
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must ensure that the consent obtained from the Data Principal is specific and unambiguous, clearly stating the purpose and scope of data processing, and any potential risks or consequences associated with data sharing.
The Data Fiduciary must not coerce or manipulate the Data Principal into providing consent. Consent must be obtained freely and without any undue influence or pressure.
The Data Fiduciary must ensure that the Data Principal is fully informed about the purposes for which their personal data will be processed, and that consent is obtained for those specific purposes.
The Data Fiduciary must maintain a record of the consent obtained from the Data Principal, including the date, time, and method of consent, as well as any relevant details about the consent process.

The Data Fiduciary must regularly review and update the consent obtained from the Data Principal to ensure that it remains valid and relevant, and to reflect any changes to data processing activities.

requirement_title: Clear and Plain Language for Consent Requests
article_text:
6. (1) The consent given by the Data Principal shall be free, specific, informed,
unconditional and unambiguous with a clear affirmative action, and shall signify an
agreement to the processing of her personal data for the specified purpose and be limited to
such personal data as is necessary for such specified purpose.
Illustration.
X, an individual, downloads Y , a telemedicine app. Y requests the consent of X for (i)
the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services, and ( ii)
accessing her mobile phone contact list, and X signifies her consent to both. Since phone
contact list is not necessary for making available telemedicine services, her consent shall be
limited to the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services.
(2) Any part of consent referred in sub-section (1) which constitutes an infringement
of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder or any other law for the time being
in force shall be invalid to the extent of such infringement.
Illustration.
X, an individual, buys an insurance policy using the mobile app or website of Y , an
insurer. She gives to Y her consent for (i) the processing of her personal data by Y for the
purpose of issuing the policy, and ( ii) waiving her right to file a complaint to the Data
Protection Board of India. Part ( ii) of the consent , relating to waiver of her right to file a
complaint, shall be invalid.
(3) Every request for consent under the provisions of this Act or the rules made
thereunder shall be presented to the Data Principal in a clear and plain language, giving her
the option to access such request in English or any language specified in the Eighth
Schedule to the Constitution and providing the contact details of a Data Protection Officer,
where applicable, or of any other person authorised by the Data Fiduciary to respond to
any communication from the Data Principal for the purpose of exercise of  her rights under
requirement: The Data Fiduciary must present consent requests in clear and plain language.
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must communicate consent requests in a way that is easy to understand, providing options for language and contact information for Data Protection Officers or other authorized personnel.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must use plain language in consent requests, avoiding technical jargon and complex terminology. Consent requests must be easy to understand and free of ambiguity.
The Data Fiduciary must ensure that consent requests are clear and unambiguous, avoiding vague or open-ended language that could be misinterpreted by individuals.

controls.control_title: Use Simple and Concise Sentence Structure
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must use simple and concise sentence structures in consent requests, making it easier for individuals to understand the purpose and scope of data collection.

controls.control_title: Provide Clear Information on Data Collection and Use
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must provide clear and concise information on what data is being collected, how it will be used, and with whom it will be shared, in a way that is easy to understand.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Consent Language
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must regularly review and update consent language to ensure it remains clear, concise, and compliant with changing regulations and industry standards.

requirement: The Data Fiduciary must limit consent to only the necessary personal data.
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must only collect and process the minimum amount of personal data required for the specified purpose, as agreed upon by the Data Principal.

controls.control: Establish a data minimization policy that outlines the types of personal data that can be collected, processed, and stored. This policy should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure it remains relevant and effective.

Develop and use data collection forms that clearly indicate which personal data is required and why it is being collected. These forms should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure they remain accurate and compliant.

Implement data access controls that restrict access to personal data to only those individuals who need it to perform their job functions. This includes implementing role-based access controls, encryption, and secure data storage practices.

Develop and implement data retention schedules that outline how long personal data will be stored and when it will be deleted or anonymized. These schedules should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure they remain compliant.

Establish procedures for handling data subject access requests, including providing individuals with access to their personal data, correcting inaccuracies, and deleting or anonymizing data upon request.

Conduct data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) for new or changed systems, processes, or technologies that may impact the processing of personal data. These assessments should identify potential risks and implement controls to mitigate them.

requirement: Any consent that infringes on laws or regulations is invalid.
requirement_description: If a consent request includes terms that violate laws or regulations, the entire consent is invalid, and the Data Fiduciary must re-obtain consent that complies with the law.

controls.control: Perform regular reviews of consent processes to ensure they comply with relevant laws and regulations. This includes reviewing changes to laws and regulations and updating consent processes accordingly.
Develop and implement a compliance framework that outlines the organization's approach to consent and ensures that all consent processes are compliant with relevant laws and regulations.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Consent Laws and Regulations
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on consent laws and regulations, including the consequences of non-compliance. This ensures that staff understand the importance of obtaining valid consent and can identify potential issues.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Consent Processes
controls.control: Maintain a record of all consent processes, including the laws and regulations that they comply with. This helps to ensure that consent processes are properly documented and can be audited if necessary.
Develop and implement a consent validation process that checks for potential issues with consent, such as invalid or incomplete information. This helps to ensure that only valid consent is accepted.

requirement: The Data Fiduciary must provide the option to access consent requests in multiple languages.
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must offer the Data Principal the option to access consent requests in languages specified in the Eighth Schedule to the Constitution, including English.

controls.control: Implement a multi-language support feature for consent requests, allowing users to select their preferred language. This feature should be accessible throughout the consent request process, including the request itself, the request details, and the request history.

Translate all content related to consent requests, including request messages, request details, and request history, into multiple languages. This translation should be accurate, up-to-date, and culturally sensitive.

Implement a language detection feature that automatically detects the user's preferred language based on their browser settings, location, or other relevant factors. This feature should be used to pre-select the user's preferred language for consent requests.

controls.control_title: Language Support for Consent Request Notifications
controls.control: Ensure that consent request notifications, including email notifications and in-app notifications, are translated into multiple languages to accommodate users who prefer to receive notifications in their native language.

controls.control_title: Language Support for Consent Request History
controls.control: Provide a language-agnostic consent request history feature that allows users to view and manage their consent request history in their preferred language. This feature should be accessible throughout the consent request history process.

requirement: The Data Fiduciary must provide contact details for Data Protection Officers or authorized personnel.
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must provide the Data Principal with contact information for Data Protection Officers or other authorized personnel who can respond to inquiries and exercise rights under the Act or rules.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must designate Data Protection Officers (DPOs) who will be responsible for overseeing data protection practices and ensuring compliance with data protection regulations. The DPOs must be easily contactable and their contact details must be publicly available.

The Data Fiduciary must ensure that the contact details of DPOs or authorized personnel are up-to-date and easily accessible. This includes maintaining accurate contact information, such as email addresses, phone numbers, and physical addresses.

The Data Fiduciary must publish the contact details of DPOs or authorized personnel on their website, making it easily accessible to data subjects. This includes providing a clear and concise way for data subjects to contact the DPOs or authorized personnel.

controls.control_title: Provide Contact Details in Data Protection Policy
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must include the contact details of DPOs or authorized personnel in their data protection policy, which must be easily accessible to data subjects. This includes providing a clear and concise way for data subjects to contact the DPOs or authorized personnel.
